meanings.definition: To cause a sudden, violent reaction of disgust or shock.
meanings.sent1: The gruesome scene in the movie revulsed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The smell of rotten food revulsed her senses.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs revulsed him, but he had to do it for a dare.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the injured animal revulsed her, stirring deep sympathy.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the spoiled milk was so revulsing that she couldn't swallow it.

meanings.definition: To feel intense disgust or horror.
meanings.sent1: She revulsed at the thought of touching the slimy creature.
meanings.sent2: He revulsed when he saw the creepy crawlies on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The idea of wearing socks with sandals revulsed her, making her cringe.
meanings.sent4: The horror movie scene revulsed him, sending shivers down his spine.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the bitter medicine was so revulsing that she gagged.

meanings.sent1: The strong smell of the garbage revulsed the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: She revulsed at the sight of the creepy crawly insect.
meanings.sent3: The thought of swimming in the murky water revulsed him, making him shudder.
meanings.sent4: The politician's dishonesty revulsed the voters, leading to his defeat.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the sour fruit was so revulsing that she spat it out.
